page.title: 02HURN COURT
page.content: {Hurn Court}is a large country house which can be found on the very southern edge of our block. Since the 1950's the house has been used as a private (fee paying) boys boarding school.{Hurn Court}is home for up to 100 boys with a further 40 boys living in a converted farmhouse about half a mile away. There has been a building on this site since the eleventh century when a {hunting lodge}was built for the use of the clergy from{Christchurch Priory.} Part of the{hunting lodge}still exits and now forms the entrance to{Hurn {Court.} For much of its existance{Hurn {Court}has been under the ownership of the{Malmesbury}family and has been used by them as thier country home.
